program: Honours in International Economics and Development
notes: Students who intend to pursue graduate studies in economics should select MAT 1300 or the sequence MAT 1320 and MAT 1322.
A strong background in mathematics helps students succeed in advanced courses and graduate studies in economics.
Students who intend to participate in the CO-OP program should take ECO 2150 and ECO 2151 in their second year.
ECO 3145, ECO 3152 and ECO 3153 are strongly recommended for studies in the Master's in Economics.

Fall: DVM1100 | Introduction to International Development and Globalization
DVM2105 | Research Methods in International Development and Globalization
Winter: DVM2106 | Quantitative Methods in International Development and Globalization
DVM3350 | Practicum in International Development and Globalization

Fall: 2 optional courses from the list of optional courses
